FuncDef: The tftp command uploads the local file to the TFTP server or download the file from the TFTP server to the local machine. The tftp command uploads the local file to the TFTP server or download the file from the TFTP server to the local machine.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the source IPv4 address of the local machine.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the IPv4 address or host name for the TFTP server.
To view the mapping between the IPv4 address and host name, run the display dns dynamic-host or display ip host command.
If the value is an IPv4 address, it is in dotted decimal notation.If the value is a host name, it is a string of case-sensitive characters without spaces.

Specifies the VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Indicates that the TFTP server on the public network is connected.
-

Specifies the downloading files from the remote TFTP server.
-

Specifies the uploading local files to the remote TFTP server.
-

Specifies the name of the source file.
Source file name is string data type. The string length range is from 1 to 128 characters. It can contain alphanumeric and special characters.

Specifies the name of the destination file.
Source file name is string data type. The string length range is from 1 to 128 characters. It can contain alphanumeric and special characters.

Examples: <HUAWEI> tftp -a 10.1.1.2 vpn-instance vpn1 10.1.1.1 get sample.txt sample1.txt
ExtraInfo: Specify the valid source IP address to communicate with the server.
